title: Bug 4971: Strange 'copy package'
description: When performing a 'copy package' operation in the Eclipse JDT UI, the selected package is not being copied to the expected destination. Instead, the copied package is being sent to a different package named 'xxx'.
OB: The 'copy package' operation is creating a package named 'xxx' instead of copying the selected package to the expected destination.
EB: The 'copy package' operation should create a package named 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' at the expected destination.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the Eclipse JDT UI
2. Select a package to copy
3. Right-click on the package and choose 'Copy'
4. Right-click on the destination package where you want to copy
5. Choose 'Paste' to perform the 'copy package' operation
6. Verify that a package named 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' is created at the expected destination
